intro: Alafia mirabilis, commonly known as the silver velvetleaf, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves with a silvery underside. The plant produces showy, pink or red flowers that are often clustered in terminal panicles. Alafia mirabilis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking foliage and floral display. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
